job_title: Campus Tour Guide in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Loved it a whole lot
cons: Pretty good gig in my opinion

review_title: Some Great Folks, Some Bratty Students and Professors
pros: Beautiful campus, some really creative people. Some benefits that are welcome
cons: Some totally spoiled brats and low pay...below poverty line.

pros: Regular staff personnel are very nice.
cons: Higher Adminstatve personal do not value staff (Admin Asst). No room to move up. Pay is awful

pros: People here are really nice and generally light on workload for students so it's balanced with schooling
cons: There are basically no benefits, you're treated like a freelancer. No bereavement time off, so I had to do extra hours during finals.

pros: Creative, committed colleagues working in complimentary disciplines
cons: Senior leadership is stagnant, directionless, without ideas, and terrible and managing both up and down. They are leading this organization further into mediocrity.

pros: Pretty easy, good insight into the department, opportunity for connections with program administrators
cons: Low pay, not particularly intellectually stimulating

pros: no growth. no opportunities, stagnant and depressing.
cons: too many to list. I warn outsiders about accepting Jobs here. NYC is super expensive and you will suffer in this city and institution.

job_title: Social Media Graduate Assistant in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Workload is easy Manageable with school work You get to meet people
cons: Will not you give notice if you want to renew academic contract, so you have to ask for it early. Otherwise, you'll loose a spot

pros: Good people, easy, great for full time student
cons: Terrible pay. Definitely not livable.

review_title: Student Part Time Duty at Pratt
pros: A nurturing environment, with great guidance from faculty and staff.
cons: Working autonomously when need be.

job_title: Library Circulation Desk Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Nice people to work with!
cons: No chance to get paid more

job_title: Computer Lab Monitor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: easy work, not too many responsibilities
cons: the pay was ok but could've been better, especially after minimum wage was increased.

pros: There is a nice campus
cons: To much demand for unpaid labor

pros: Pratt is a great institution and anyone who has the opportunity to work there or attend classes is at a distinct advantage over anyone who has not.
cons: There are very few negatives when it comes to Pratt. If forced to say something negative I would have to discuss the cafeteria food. Although I think it is getting better.

job_title: Student Laser Shop Monitor in New York, NY
pros: You learn a lot, and get access to the machinery over other students which is great. The coworkers are your peers and professors which is also nice.
cons: Hours assigned sporadically, can be tough to juggle with schoolwork. Very hard to get a job here, most applicants are not accepted and the pay is not good. It used to be above minimum wage, but the pay has not increased for years. It barely offsets anything financially so if you are looking to supplement your income to pay for school look elsewhere.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Freedom and trust from administration, amazing and creative students
cons: Heavy reliance on part time teachers, although there is typically a pathway towards promotion/advancement

review_title: Decent place to work but pays little.
pros: Peace of mind and generally sweet people.
cons: Less pay for more work and mismanagement.

job_title: Graduate Assistant Non Teaching in Brooklyn, NY
pros: good for resume and free money
cons: I expected to gain some teaching experience but course profs didn't allow any teaching from students so I really didn't do anything

pros:
Sense of community 
Interesting alums
Passionate Professors 
Engaged students
cons:
Hard work life balance
 Difficult commute for non-Brooklynites 
low morale

pros: Loved it, would recommend the job to others seeking ceramics experience
cons: Please pay your graduate students more than minimum wage

job_title: Art Gallery Assistant in New York, NY
pros: amazing people and real world experience
cons: pratt has a hard time paying people on time

review_title: Good job, terrible HR and payroll departments
pros: Good benefits and general culture.
cons:
I didn't receive the proper pay for 3 months because someone in the payroll or HR department lost my promotion paperwork on their desk. My direct manager checked in on the status of my promotion multiple times but my department manager didn’t even bother. Eventually my pay was updated but I never received the appropriate amount of backpay. 

HR also has a policy of cancelling your pre-tax transit card 2 months after your employment ends, which means that they steal wages from every employee who doesn’t use up the money on that card within 2 months.

pros: Great communication, guidance and explanation for requirements
cons: There were no cons, I had a great working part-time environment

review_title: Like any job with its ups and downs
job_title: Shop Assistant in New York, NY
pros: My employer was an absolutely amazing person which made the experience positive. The hours are somewhat at your control which was nice, and since we were students working here my employer encouraged us to do our schoolwork on downtime which was great.
cons: Sometimes the students would feel very entitled and talk down to you.

pros: autonomy and agency. no one interferes or cares about my teaching
cons: very low pay for part-time faculty and very little support for students

job_title: Student Lab Monitor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: A super chill part time job where you can even get homework done
cons: None really. Just show up ! :)

pros: excellent facilities and knowledgable specialists
cons: studio seminar and writing all too similar and not enough variety in professors

pros: great experience here and great people
cons: I have to work weekends

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Brooklyn, NY

job_title: Print Lab Technician in Brooklyn, NY

cons: Working around work study compensation was hard, like if you worked more than you were allotted for work study it was hard to figure out and get compensated but it usually worked out. Just a pain.

pros: Flexible hours, good working knowledge
cons: More responsibilities than monitors, but getting paid the same

job_title: Visiting Instructor in New York, NY

cons: Haven’t been here long enough to say anything bad.

pros: As adjunct, faculty can work their way to getting tenure status eventually.
cons: As an adjunct at Pratt, I teach more classes than most full time faculty in other institutions for 1/3 of the salary. Similarly at Pratt, I teach one less class than my full-time peers and get 1/3 of their salary too.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in New York, NY

job_title: Associate Professor, College Or University in New York, NY

cons: Pratt is a terribly run institution. Sure, most academic institutions have major issues, but Pratt is head and shoulders above the rest in mismanagement, disrespect towards its faculty, nepotism, incompetence, and corruption.

job_title: Computer Lab Monitor in Brooklyn, NY

pros:
Hardworking students
A handful of quality faculty 
Outside park-like campus setting
cons:
Adjunct unionized faculty are not reviewed yearly. department stuck with them.
Overly bureaucratic. Many- Lifers, people who sit back and collect salaries but don't care about improving the experience for students or developing more efficient or effective systems.
Faculty have it made. Some come in for a day or two and receive full pay; while others work more with out any difference in salaries or compensation. . Poor HR

pros: Office Culture, Campus Environment, Benefits, Flexibility, Work Life Balance
cons: Low Pay, Zero Advancement Opportunities, Did I mention low pay? Do you like being an adult with roommates? Do you like having time off without the funds to do anything with it? No bonuses. No raises outside of those linked to inflation.

pros:
Flexible hours to accommodate my student schedule and camaraderie with other student workers
Good pay for higher skilled jobs
cons: Base pay was less than 15/hr when I worked there several years ago

job_title: Architecture Shop Monitor in New York, NY
pros: Rodrigo Guajardo was an incredible boss. Flexible hours that work with a student's schedule.
cons: No opportunity for a promotion.

pros: Wonderful coworkers and students. Some departments are run very smoothly and respectfully. Some very poorly.
cons: A lot of bureaucracy. Departments are very isolated from each other.

pros: Great work environment, colleagues, and students. Admin opaque.
cons: "Part Time" Faculty teaching 3 courses per semester, serving on 3 committees--doing full time work for part time pay.

pros: Pratt is a good school

review_title: Best place to work as a student

cons: I have no cons for this job

pros: Taught me to communicate and listen effectively
cons: Always on call with residents

pros: Great students and staff. Very diverse culture.
cons: I was part time for 3 years hoping to go full time. Had to leave for another opportunity

pros: The salary was pretty good, the people I worked with were awesome
cons: unorganized, lack of communication, most people have more than one title so the work load can be overwhelming

pros: Great CoWorkers and Dept. Head
cons: Only Remote Classes So Far

pros: Flexible scheduling and academic perks

review_title: Upholds Misogyny and Racism, No HR help when needed
job_title: Assistant to the Chair in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Got hired, benefits, paid bi-weekly, access to accomplished artists
cons: Misogynist environment, only men are in charge, harassed on a daily basis, reported to HR, HR protects higher level staff and doesn't care about assistants or students, racist "humor", disgusting environment to work in if you're a woman or person of color, overworked, always on-call, underpaid

job_title: DOC Technician in New York, NY
pros: flexible student hours and stuff
cons: non consitent paying periods, managment is all over the place, not really that great tbh

pros: Flexible during COVID quarantine (work from home)
cons: Colleagues were laid off, furloughed, retirement cut in half.

review_title: University workforce in the middle of residential area
pros: Dedicated professors,  interesting art students and academic assignments. Lectures, outdoor graduation day. Great benefits working in higher education 20 plus days vacation, over 10 sick days, personal days, tuition reimbursement at other colleges, 403B annuity plan. Relaxed atmosphere vs. faced paced NYC companies. Parking lots if you want to drive to work. Nice library.
cons: Crime in the area. Thefts on campus and dorm rooms. The G train station. Distance from NYC. Takes too long to implement certain administrative actions. Turnover of higher management particularly Institutional Advancement. Or no turnover -some people stay for years in the same job. . No new ideas, just the same drones.

review_title: Not A Progressive Workplace--Needs a New Vision for Management
pros: The people who work here are great. Creative, open, non-competative, friendly, student centered.
cons: The management, at least in the department I worked in, ruled by fear. A kind of "do what I say and don't question it or there will be problems." Everyone was afraid of the director and her newly appointed assistant. I was told "stay on her good side because she doesn't care about you  or your job." and "the director won't let you do any professional development--she doesn't want anyone advancing."

review_title: Great to work for such an amazing student body
pros: The best part about Pratt is the students, they are incredibly talented and it was a pleasure for me to manage a lab there and teach a few classes. The campus is in Fort Greene in Brooklyn and has beautiful buildings and garden. Benefits are good if you are a full-time employee.
cons: Pay rates are based on a Union's policy, and although the Union reps work tirelessly to represent us, the Union "grades" are often miss-aligned with the duties and responsibilities of some of the studio technicians, making it impossible to earn a competitive salary in NY. After 5 years I was forced to quit a job a loved because I just couldn't get enough for my work and expertise.

review_title: Private School, Bad Employers, Horrible Pay
pros: Nice campus, some enthusiastic students, some diversity, some benefits, good food nearby, some great faculty who are really great in their field and you can learn a lot just being around them, lots of artists who are very interesting
cons: Most benefits have strings (for example the "free courses & tuition" for employees requires you still pay hundreds [up to $500] for 'student activity fee' that replicates the benefits you already get as an employee, like gym access); some of the students don't want to be there and are brats; some of the faculty are inexperienced or no experience in their field which leads to petty battles over things.

review_title: A job for the sake of a job
pros:
- Friendly environment
- Beautiful campus
- Decent benefits
- Good hours/holidays for union positions
cons:
- Not much room for growth once you've reached the highest level in the department (short of taking your boss' job)
- Repetitive cycle of tasks without much innovation 
- Little/no support for professional development
- Projects/work can be very dependent on self-motivation
- Lack of respect from one department to the next (especially bad for any service departments)

review_title: Experience as an instructor in the school is mediocre, as a result of the unorganized management of administration
pros:
Generally, a strong set of students admitted to the Graduate Architecture program
Access to the professionals in the NYC Area, a big plus
Adjunct professors bring in a wealth of practical knowledge
cons:
Not enough communication between the administration and many part-time and full-time instructors
Appears that the administration's mannerisms to manage the staff is through last minute decisions for the staff, putting staff in an awkward position

pros: Pratt has wonderful students, and most people who actually work there are truly and deeply invested in providing the student body with the best education that they can.
cons: Some professors and administrators are more interested in their own ego than their jobs. Meetings about policy tend to be exercises in intersectionality rather than genuine efforts to make decisions that improve the institute.

job_title: Adjunct Assistant Professor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: One of the most beautiful campuses of any art school anywhere. You are also in the center of Brooklyn, a hotbed of creative activity and new restaurants. In the computer arts department, the administration is very supportive, and looking to make the department better any time they can.
cons: Budgets for new programs, and keeping the infrastructure up to date are sometimes lacking.

pros: Beautiful campus, tuition remission, fun and interesting events on campus, dedicated (mostly) faculty, strong library collections
cons: Disorganized, lack of accountability, frequent disregard for students, high turnover, horrible toxic cut throat environment allowed to thrive

review_title: Great if you have a great boss
pros:
I was a shop monitor for over 2 years. I was lucky to have the most amazing manager/boss ever, he made up for his boss, who is a bureaucratic fawner. My manager was an incredible mentor figure that is going to set a very high standard for all my future employers.

About the job, is great to not having to travel far from school to work.
cons: Dealing with students demands, specially during midterms or finals, can get really stressful.

review_title: No imagination in a place of "innovation"
job_title: Graduate Assistant in New York, NY
pros:
Little to no supervision-very self directed work
Nice Working environment with natural light
Nice staff around
Good compensation for the work
cons:
No stable funding-at least in our dept
Lack of accountability from higher staff
Lack of growth
Lack of privacy

job_title: Adjunct Associate Professor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Great students , Great Faculty . I love being there. I am encouraged to bring my personal experience and point of view into my classroom
cons: There is never enough money in teaching and Pratt is no exception. There are some administrative conflicts that have effected us as professors.

review_title: Poor management which leads to infighting, attrition
pros: Mission of Institute, tuition reimbursement, location, beautiful campus
cons: Lack of funds and low salary means inexperienced, unqualified staff, often with no management skills

pros: Very welcome and nice working environment, can get chances to see lots of amazing portfolios from applicants from all over the world, can wear casually.
cons: It's just a normal office job, don't expect there is a lot of fun since it's a design school

job_title: Assistant to the Chair in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Great for people who like to multitask and work on a variety of projects. Really nice coworkers that are great to work with. Also Pratt offers really good benefit packages and work life balance.
cons: This only applies if you are looking to advance your career, this position doesn't offer an opportunity to move up.

job_title: Adjunct Lecturer in New York, NY
pros: Great students - enthusiastic, interested, and motivated. The teaching relationship with students is rewarding. However, as a professor I don't feel supported by management and tech services.
cons: Systems and management are confusing and outdated. Everyone in admin seems overworked and underpaid. No pay for prep time. Very low pay per hour compared to similar schools in NYC.

job_title: Architecture Shop Monitor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Great interaction with all the students.  Learned a ton of people communication skills during stressful  situations.
cons: It can get tough during finals, everyone's running on little sleep and stress. But supervisors and bosses are very tuned into everyone's health and well-being to keep the shops running smoothly and safely.

pros: The (undeserved) reputation of the school means that the calibre of students is high.
cons:
Everything else.
The place is supposed to be an art school but is essentially run like a very strict high school.
Lots of rules. No flexibility.
Department run by people who have no connection to the subject taught there and actively work against inspiring students. 
Head of department was described by one of my students as a “politician who is unaware he has constituents”.

pros: Beautiful campus. Mostly engaged students.
cons: Academic and Financial/Service departments are expected to function with 1/3 of the staff of comparable schools while Admissions, Institutional Advancement and Communications are bloated and ineffective. Searches for staff jobs are not done by hiring committees. Advancement and staff placement is entirely up to the whims of the department head. This leads to racism, sexism, and favoritism.

pros: Students were talented and mostly hard working. The campuses are gorgeous and facilities mostly good.
cons: The administration had room for improvement and did not handle multicampus issues well.

review_title: Good faculties, very nice people. Sometimes they can be intense though. I mean supervisor.
job_title: Graduate Assistant in New York, NY
pros:
Easy job.
Good for international students to set up confidence.
Get international students social security number.
Learn how to be professional in education.
cons:
Not much challenge, not much money.
Not really helpful for career path. 
If you wanna be a teacher after graduation, it's a good choice.

job_title: Professional Development Specialist in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Since beginning work here there is always movement towards improvement and an openness for feedback. Though often every day conditions are highly dependent on direct management, there is an ability to voice concerns.
cons: It can take a lot of time for small things like title changes to actually go through.

pros: Great Benefits, very regarding work environment especially for artists still making work and trying to be active in the art world. Guaranteed 3 % Raise.
cons: Not paid very much in comparison to my obligations

pros: Great people to work with, relaxed environment. A lot of potential perks and discounts. Very flexible with time off/accommodating with other jobs and vacations.
cons: Not much pay, pratt in general does have a lot of bureaucracy and the some of the people in other departments are insufferable

pros: Beautiful campus, acess to great art and events.
cons: It is a shame that such a great place has such a negative working culture. Personnel and colleagues can at times be combative and unprofessional. HR is unresponsive

pros: Very structured HR with each department, clear communication with payroll, easy to work with, accommodates student workers very well.
cons: Summer hours are different. Some departments are harder to apply for, especially the labs.

pros: Dynamic environment with great students.    So many creative, inspiring people on a beautiful 32 acre campus.
cons: Administration is not diverse.  The president of at the time was ancient.  Leadership lacking at every level.

review_title: Center for Career and Professional Development CCPD

cons: Unorganized. Needs a better system for tracking data, etc.  Again, I am referring to the CCPD at Pratt.

review_title: Look for a chill professor to work with

review_title: Full of bureaucracy but good opp for students

cons: Aside from being asked to created a promotional poster for a gallery exhibit (on campus), it isn't the professional experience a student needs.

review_title: Outlook for adjuncts is grim. Otherwise not a bad place to teach.

cons: Impossible to advance; no benefits; worry about classes/pay being cut every semester

cons: Pay is not as much as you would wish it to be but with the benefits its hard to complain.

pros: Hours are flexible and you get to trouble shoot a great deal
cons: 20 hour limit for part time

pros: The creative energy at Pratt is palpable. The students are the best part, articulate, hardworking, gifted, and smart.  The faculty are excellent.
cons: Commute if you don't live in Brooklyn.

pros: Work is not too demanding
cons: Pay is ridiculously low, no likelihood of advancement, faculty and students can be unreasonable and disrespectful/demeaning

pros: Great campus, Creative environment, great people
cons: Professional development lacking...upper management not the greatest

pros: The staff team had each others back all the time and there is a good sense of community

review_title: Great people and students with lots of room for improvement

pros: Getting students in shape and knowledgeable about living a healthier lifestyle

pros: Wonderful people dedicated to the arts.
cons: In a few programs there is money being thrown towards outrageous investments.

pros: I worked for the Digital Arts Department. I had a very nice supervisor so it was a fun job.

review_title: Great experience as a student employee. Training and payment.
